item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克警告不要长期维持限制性政策立场
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周三表示，美国央行不能再将利率维持在过高的水平，否则有可能对就业造成太大的损害。【原文：The U.S. central bank must not keep interest rates too high much longer or it risks causing too much harm to employment, Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 通用汽车电池合资企业同意承认田纳西州工厂的 UAW
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）周三表示，通用汽车与 LG Energy Solution 的电池制造合资企业已同意承认田纳西州一家工厂的工会。【原文：The United Auto Workers said Wednesday a battery manufacturing joint venture between GM and LG Energy Solution has agreed to recognize the union at a Tennessee plant.】

item.title: 俄罗斯皇家银行援引消息人士的话称，莫斯科批准联合利华剥离俄罗斯资产的交易
item.description: 据《RBC 商业日报》周三援引熟悉内情的未具名消息人士的话报道，消费品巨头联合利华已获得俄罗斯政府批准出售其在俄罗斯的资产。【原文：Consumer goods giant Unilever has received Russian government approval to sell its assets in Russia, the RBC business daily reported on Wednesday, citing unnamed sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司改进混合动力 SUV，计划不再使用纯电动汽车
item.description: 沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）周三表示，插电式混合动力车仍将是其未来几年利润增长计划的重要组成部分，该公司将对其 XC90 混合动力运动型多用途车（SUV）进行改造。【原文：Volvo Cars said on Wednesday that plug-in hybrids would continue to be a critical part of its profit growth plans over the next few years and that it would revamp its XC90 hybrid sports utility vehicle (SUV).】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司警告称新日铁交易失败可能危及数以千计的工作岗位
item.description: 美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel）周三警告说，如果不能与新日本制铁公司（Nippon Steel）合并，数以千计的美国工会岗位将面临风险，并将导致这家美国钢铁制造商在很大程度上脱离其高炉设施，还可能导致其总部搬迁。【原文：U.S. Steel warned Wednesday that a failure to merge with Nippon Steel would put thousands of U.S union jobs at risk and result in the American steelmaker largely pivoting away from its blast furnace facilities and potentially moving its headquarters.】

item.title: 对冲基金在八月过山车行情中保持收益
item.description: 银行研究报告和熟悉对冲基金业绩的消息来源周三显示，尽管流行的日元套息交易平仓对市场造成了冲击，但全球对冲基金仍在 8 月份取得了积极的业绩。【原文：Global hedge funds posted positive results in August even as the unwind in popular yen carry trades whipsawed markets, bank research and sources familiar with the funds' performance showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称 Citadel 旗舰基金 8 月份上涨约 1
item.description: 一位熟知内情的消息人士称，Citadel 旗舰对冲基金 Wellington 在 8 月份的涨幅约为 1%，而 8 月份一开始股票就遭到了惨烈的抛售。【原文：Citadel's flagship hedge fund Wellington was up roughly 1% in August, a source familiar with the matter said, in a month which started with a brutal selloff in equities.】

item.title: 加拿大 7 月贸易平衡转为盈余
item.description: 加拿大统计局周三公布的数据显示，由于进口下降速度快于出口，加拿大7月份出现了6.84亿加元（5.05亿美元）的贸易顺差，而6月份的收支平衡经修正后显示为逆差而非顺差。【原文：Canada posted a trade surplus of C$684 million ($505 million) in July as imports declined faster than exports, while the June balance was revised to show a deficit rather than a surplus, Statistics Canada data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英伟达和芯片股在前一天的抛售后摇摆不定
item.description: 以市值领头羊英伟达（Nvidia）为首的芯片公司在上一交易日遭遇沉重抛售后，周三将扩大跌幅，这反映出随着人工智能乐观情绪的降温，华尔街对这些股票的高估值日益感到担忧。【原文：Chip companies led by market cap leader Nvidia were set to extend losses on Wednesday after a bruising sell-off in the previous session, reflecting the growing concern on Wall Street over the stocks' lofty valuations as AI optimism cools.】

item.title: 独家报道：OpenAI 联合创始人 Sutskever 的新安全人工智能初创公司 SSI 融资 10 亿美元
item.description: 公司高管告诉路透社，由 OpenAI 前首席科学家伊利亚-苏茨克沃（Ilya Sutskever）新近共同创立的安全超级智能公司（SSI）已经筹集了 10 亿美元现金，用于帮助开发远超人类能力的安全人工智能系统。【原文：Safe Superintelligence (SSI), newly co-founded by OpenAI's former chief scientist Ilya Sutskever, has raised $1 billion in cash to help develop safe artificial intelligence systems that far surpass human capabilities, company executives told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 7 月贸易逆差因进口而扩大
item.description: 7 月份，美国贸易赤字大幅扩大，原因是企业因预期商品关税将提高而提前进口，这表明贸易可能在第三季度继续拖累经济增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened sharply in July as businesses front-loaded imports in anticipation of higher tariffs on goods, suggesting that trade could remain a drag on economic growth in the third quarter.】

item.title: 美国股市大跌加剧经济衰退担忧，挫败降息预期
item.description: 对美国经济前景的不安日益加剧，加上本月股市的季节性疲软，造成了又一场全球市场波动的完美风暴，让投资者争相寻求保护，并担心出现新一轮的货币混乱。【原文：Mounting unease over the U.S. economic outlook and a seasonally weak month for stocks have created another perfect storm of global market volatility, leaving investors scrambling for protection and fearing another round of currency chaos.】

item.title: 诺德斯特龙创始人以每股 23 美元的价格将百货公司私有化
item.description: 本周三的一份文件显示，诺德斯特龙（Nordstrom）的创始家族已提出将这家连锁百货公司私有化的计划，他们将以每股 23 美元的现金收购尚未持有的股份。【原文：Nordstrom's founding family has made a bid to take the department store chain private by offering $23 per share in cash for the stake they do not already own, a filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司放弃近期纯电动汽车野心
item.description: 瑞典汽车制造商沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）周三表示，该公司已放弃到 2030 年只销售全电动汽车的雄心壮志，届时将允许插电式汽车和一些混合动力汽车成为其产品系列的一部分。【原文：Swedish automaker Volvo Cars said on Wednesday it had abandoned is ambition to sell only fully electric cars by 2030, and would instead allow plug-in vehicles as well as some hybrid engine cars as part of its lineup at that time.】

item.title: 埃克森与阿布扎比 ADNOC 将合作开发德克萨斯州延期的氢气项目
item.description: 阿布扎比国家石油公司（ADNOC）将收购埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp）在得克萨斯州拟建的低碳氢气项目 35% 的股权，两家公司宣布推迟一年到 2029 年启动该项目。【原文：Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) will acquire a 35% equity stake in Exxon Mobil Corp's proposed low-carbon hydrogen project in Texas, with the companies announcing a one-year start-up delay until 2029.】

item.title: Lyft 将出售部分自行车和滑板车资产
item.description: 共享乘车平台 Lyft 周三表示，作为降低成本的重组计划的一部分，公司将出售一些与自行车和滑板车相关的资产。【原文：Ride-sharing platform Lyft said on Wednesday it will sell some assets related to bikes and scooters as part of a restructuring plan to reduce costs.】

item.title: 英国批准微软与 Inflection AI 合作
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周三批准了微软聘用 Inflection AI 部分前员工以及与该初创公司合作的申请，并表示无需对该交易进行更深入的调查。【原文：Britain's competition regulator, on Wednesday, cleared Microsoft's hiring of some former staff of Inflection AI and its partnership with the startup and said the deal did not required a deeper investigation.】

item.title: 从种族隔离到加沙，消费者抵制行动多年来一直打击着各大公司
item.description: 多年来，包括安海斯-布希-英博（Anheuser-Busch InBev）、可口可乐（Coca-Cola）和塔吉特（Target）在内的全球公司都曾因购物者抵制其产品或服务而导致销售额下降，有时甚至名誉受损。【原文：HGlobal companies including Anheuser-Busch InBev , Coca-Cola and Target have suffered hits to sales and, in some cases, reputations, after shoppers boycotted their products or services over the years.】

item.title: 火鸡价格下跌，荷美尔食品公司下调年度销售预期
item.description: Skippy 花生酱生产商荷美尔食品公司（Hormel Foods）周三下调了年度销售预期，原因是受到商品价格下降以及位于弗吉尼亚州的 Planters 品牌生产厂生产中断的影响。【原文：Skippy peanut butter maker Hormel Foods cut its annual sales forecast on Wednesday, hurt by lower commodity prices and a production disruption at its Planters brand manufacturing facility in Virginia.】

item.title: 大众汽车法德国汽车制造商所有权结构解读
item.description: 大众汽车计划关闭在德国的工厂并解除与工会的长期劳资协议，这使其独特的治理和所有权结构成为焦点，多年来，这种治理和所有权结构一直受到投资者的批评。【原文：Volkswagen's plan to close plants in Germany and dissolve long-standing labour agreements with unions has put the spotlight on its unique governance and ownership structure that have drawn criticism from investors for years.】

item.title: 美元树公司因需求疲软下调年度预期
item.description: 折扣店运营商 Dollar Tree 周三下调了年度业绩预期，原因是该公司在通胀严重的情况下，难以吸引对价格敏感的购物者购买利润较高的商品，导致股价在盘前交易中下跌约 9%。【原文：Discount store operator Dollar Tree cut annual forecasts on Wednesday, as it struggled to lure in price-sensitive shoppers for its more profitable higher-margin goods amid sticky inflation, sending shares down about 9% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 消息人士称欧佩克+正在讨论推迟十月石油增产计划
item.description: 欧佩克+组织的三位消息人士周三告诉路透社，由于油价创下9个月来的最低点，该组织正在讨论推迟下个月的增产计划。【原文：OPEC+ is discussing a delay in a planned output increase next month as oil prices hit their lowest in 9 months, three sources from the producer group told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 劳动力数据公布前，经济增长忧虑令期指下滑
item.description: 由于对美国经济健康状况的担忧挥之不去，与华尔街主要指数挂钩的期货在周三晚些时候的劳工数据公布前下滑。【原文：Futures tied to Wall Street's main indexes slipped ahead of labor data expected later on Wednesday as worries lingered about the health of the U.S. economy.】

item.title: 股市下挫，但台积电和三星在大型展会上看好人工智能
item.description: 全球最重要的两家芯片制造商--台湾台积电和韩国三星电子--的高管周三在一个大型贸易展上对人工智能前景表示看好，尽管这两家公司的股票在当天的市场大跌。【原文：Senior executives from two of the world's most important chipmakers, Taiwan's TSMC and South Korea's Samsung Electronics , offered bullish outlooks for artificial intelligence at a major trade show on Wednesday even as their stocks tanked on a fevered day on the markets.】

item.title: 洞察力：可口可乐和百事可乐因加沙问题遭抵制，穆斯林国家的本土苏打水受到影响
item.description: 几十年来，可口可乐公司和竞争对手百事可乐公司花费数亿美元，在穆斯林占多数的国家（包括埃及和巴基斯坦）扩大对其软饮料的需求。【原文：Coca-Cola and rival PepsiCo spent hundreds of millions of dollars over decades building demand for their soft drinks in Muslim-majority countries including Egypt to Pakistan.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，如果 149 亿美元的新日铁交易失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂并搬迁总部
item.description: 华尔街日报》周三援引对美国钢铁公司首席执行官的采访报道称，如果新日铁以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的计划失败，美国钢铁公司将关闭工厂，并可能将总部迁出匹兹堡。【原文：U.S. Steel would close mills and likely move its headquarters out of Pittsburgh if the $14.9 billion buyout by Nippon Steel collapses, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing an interview with the company's CEO.】

item.title: 早间竞价工厂不景气，股市季节性打喷嚏
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国东海岸港口工会就工资要求召开会议，为可能的罢工做准备
item.description: 国际码头工人协会（International Longshoremen's Association）工会代表着从得克萨斯州到缅因州主要集装箱港口的 45,000 名工人，将于周三开始为期两天的会议，审查工资要求并为 10 月 1 日可能举行的罢工做准备。【原文：The International Longshoremen's Association union, representing 45,000 workers at major container ports from Texas to Maine, will begin two days of meetings on Wednesday to review wage demands and prepare for a potential strike on Oct. 1.】

item.title: 迪斯尼和 DirecTV 争夺重塑电视捆绑业务
item.description: 高管和专家表示，最初只是卫星电视供应商 DirecTV 为分销沃尔特-迪斯尼（Walt Disney）电视网络所支付费用的例行讨价还价，现在却变成了对捆绑式节目未来的公投。【原文：What began as routine haggling over the rates satellite TV provider DirecTV would pay to distribute Walt Disney's television networks is turning into a referendum on the future of bundled programming, executives and experts said.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，博通测试令人失望，英特尔制造业务受挫
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，英特尔与芯片制造商博通（Broadcom）的测试失败后，该公司的合同制造业务遭遇挫折，这对该公司的扭亏为盈努力造成了打击。【原文：Intel's contract manufacturing business has suffered a setback after tests with chipmaker Broadcom failed, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, dealing a blow to the company's turnaround efforts.】
